newsitem.title: CHINA: China, Mexico sign pact to halt illegal drug trade.
newsitem.headline: China, Mexico sign pact to halt illegal drug trade.

text.p: China and Mexico signed an agreement on Friday to cooperate in fighting drug trafficking.
The accord sets a framework for exchanging information between anti-drug trafficking agencies of the two countries, a Mexican official said.
A key target was stopping the diversion of shipments of chemicals used in legal pharmaceutical products for use in manufacturing illegal drugs, the official said.
China has a growing chemicals industry and it also has played an increasingly important role in the international drug trade, according to anti-narcotics officials in Beijing.
The official Xinhua news agency said the accord was signed as part of the visit of Mexican President Ernesto Zedillo.
Zedillo, who is leading a delegation of Mexican businessmen, met Chinese President Jiang Zemin and Premier Li Peng on Friday.

The two sides also signed an agreement on agricultural cooperation as well as an accord allowing Mexico's consulate in Hong Kong to remain after the British colony reverts to Chinese rule on July 1, 1997.
